title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
author: Gabriel García Márquez
description: A masterpiece of Latin American literature that tells the story of the Buendía family in the fictional town of Macondo.

title: Don Quixote
author: Miguel de Cervantes
description: The story of a nobleman who decides to become a knight-errant and lives numerous adventures.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel that explores themes of surveillance, totalitarianism, and truth manipulation.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A love story and misunderstandings in 19th century England, centered on the life of Elizabeth Bennet.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A portrait of the Jazz Age in America, centered on the life of the mysterious millionaire Jay Gatsby.

title: Moby Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: The story of Captain Ahab's obsession with hunting the white whale, Moby Dick.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A novel that examines morality through the story of a young man who commits murder.

title: The Trial
author: Franz Kafka
description: The story of a man who is arrested and tried for a crime that is never revealed to him.

title: Fahrenheit 451
author: Ray Bradbury
description: A dystopian novel about a future where books are banned and firefighters burn any books they find.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: The story of a young shepherd who seeks treasure and discovers his true destiny.
